title: Altus Power Secures $600 Million Solar Panel Partnership
sub_head: Renewable-energy company to install solar panels on 35 million square feet of industrial property in development pipeline across U.S.
body:
Solar-power company Altus Power Inc. and commercial real-estate developer Trammell Crow Co. have reached a deal to install solar panels on 35 million square feet of U.S. industrial property, the latest sign that sustainability is becoming a growing concern of commercial property owners.
Altus will install solar panels on properties in Trammell’s development pipeline at a cost of $600 million, and make further investments in battery-storage capacity, electric-vehicle charging stations and other environmentally friendly technologies, said Co-Chief Executive Lars Norell. Altus will then sell the clean power that it generates, mostly to Trammell’s tenants, at a discount from the grid price.
